str2: On the contrary, on the other hand. Contraction for the neuter of ho and enantion; on the contrary.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From akron and probably a modified form of posthe; the prepuce; by implication, an uncircumcised state or person.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
